page.title: 02House of Tongue SUTHERLAND
page.content: The Countess of Sutherland lives in Tongue House which has been in the family for 160 years. There are actually two houses, the laird's housebuilt in 1720, and the factor's house which was built in 1678 and has buttresses. There is a door in the outer wall on Kyleside which came from Lochmaddy gaol. This door opens on to a passage which crofters used when they came to pay their rents to the factor. The walls are very thick and the windows very small with small panes of glass. There are stables and a doocot, and rooms where servants lived in the old days. There is a lot of carpeting in the Mackay tartan. There is also a very big garden with a wall round it. After Lady Sutherland showed us round the house, she gave us coke and cake and we chatted.
